review_title: One of the best place to get experience and also working with great professionals
job_title: Pilot, First Officer in Sioux Lookout, ON
pros: Good experience Working with pros Amazing team great benefit
cons: A bit low salary Working in remote area

job_title: First Officer (Fixed Wing) in Thunder Bay, ON
pros: - The company takes care of their own employees - Friendly people - Funny people, but knows when to be professional - Great benefits - Great maintenance crew. Airplanes are always in good condition - Superb training - 703 operator that operates like a 705 - Recession proof - because it is government funded, it does give comfort of stability
cons: - Not able to commute to work from outside of the three bases - From word of mouth, pilots will fly 400~600 hours in a year - At the time of this review (2023), First Officers are still getting paid the 2020 salary as an agreement has not been reached.

pros: Nothing postive Nothing Nothing Nothing Nothing good or pros working in this company.
cons: Management is unsupported. Blame you Some old captains sitting in the company for 15 yrs think they know everything and treat you bad.

pros: Frontline Staff are great. They deserve every penny they earn
cons: Management is questionable. Nothing sure about their thought process on a lot of things, from hiring to firing. They are trying to do everything all at once and there is a fear that everything will just collapse from everyone being burned out

pros: Ornge is a nice company to work with.

review_title: Safe employment in all economic situations
job_title: Rotary Wing Pilot in Sudbury, ON
pros: Excellent training, outstanding maintenance, unmatched benefits in the industry, very predictable schedule
cons: Not enough pilots, paramedics and AMEs

review_title: Compassion is in the mission statement
pros:
- Helping people (cliché but true)
- Great people to work with in the trenches, always a hand to help you out of a mess.
- Compassionate management - this is personal, I had a family illness to deal with, the company bent over backwards and did cartwheels to accommodate my family needs. Then they still hired me to full time off of my contract even though I am guaranteed to miss a lot more time in the future.
- Open Gym
cons:
Swing shift work - Can be challenging if you are swing employee and your personal plans get squashed for operational needs. Its expected as this is a 24 hour Emergency service.

Stress - we deal with the most sick people in the province. Their very lives are on the line. It can go from calm to chaotic in a minute and you need to bring your A game 24/7. Constant stories of personal tragedy is a lot to deal with day in, day out.

job_title: Communications Officer Medical in Mississauga, ON
pros:
. Nice co-workers 
. Great training team
. Nice facility
cons: Nothing that I can recall

job_title: Fixed Wing Pilot in Sioux Lookout, ON
pros: The training goes far above than what they need to do which is great and makes all pilots more proficient.
cons: No cons to share as of now

job_title: Manager Infrastructure, End User Support and Cyber Security in Mississauga, ON
pros: Communicative, friendly, helpful, everyone is motivated to work towards the company’s mission.
cons: Hiring process was long. Can be a positive to really ensure the prospective candidate is the right fit however some talent might end up taking positions with competing companies for that talent. Something to consider in the IT hiring process.

review_title: Amazing Organization and even better people
pros:
- Great mission to help the people of Ontario get the care they need.
- Amazing people and culture and work ethics to work alongside.
- Great executive leadership with a progressive vision.
- Feel appreciated and valued as an employee.
- I see the difference each employee makes in their own unique role.
- Continuous improvement is prevalent. Your opinion on how to improve is valued.
- Learning organization that encourages education, training and continuous improvement in one self.
- Competitive salary compensation, benefits and pension plan.
cons: Career progression may be limited in certain roles due to unique industry and limited company growth in size.

pros: Great people, very friendly and helpful
cons: Shift work, can sometimes be hard

pros: Time Off, High Job Satisfaction
cons: Night Shifts, Missing holidays etc

pros: laid back and relaxed place of work
cons: no cons that come to mind

pros: Stable, average compensation, good work/life balance... Nice people to work with
cons: Too much politics, favoritism based on personal relationship not related to work ... Average compensation

job_title: Maintenance Training Instructor in Mississauga, ON
pros: Very good staff to work with. Comfortable work conditions. Flexibility. Provides a very essential service to the public. Multiple locations. Lots and lots of training and courses to start.
cons: Hard to get up to speed. A lot of the initial training is online and impersonal.

review_title: This department is from another planet!
pros:
vacation
pension
sick days
working with top frontline heros!
cons:
1) discriminatory selection in hiring/progression/ training.
2) friends reporting direct to friends - conflicts of interest
3) known female bully being tolerated and enabled.
4) divide and concur and rule by fear

job_title: Critical Care Paramedic in Thunder Bay, ON
pros: The rare satisfaction of treating an honestly sick patient and going home feeling I did something for someone. The experienced frontline workers are nearly second to none and will always have your back regardless of managements shenanigans.
cons: The sense of savings being more important than performing the services the people of Ontario pay us to provide. A lack treatment of employees as skilled individuals with loads of experience vs. just meat in the seat is very demoralizing. Hiring practices have fallen to include completely inexperienced individuals. This is a result of our reputations decline and a lack of adequate applicants.

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Mississauga, ON
pros: Ornge is a company that really cares about Ontarians, regardless what department you work for, you feel you are contributing to something big. Personally, I had the opportunity to be promoted 2 times in less than 3 years. Employees are treated with respect.
cons: A bit conservative sometimes in some ways of doing things.

pros:
